content.title: Tibial Vessel Injury

key_concepts.details: Single tibial artery injury usually tolerated if two remaining vessels intact
Consider repair if only one patent tibial vessel or ischemic foot
Generally safe to ligate isolated tibial artery injury with intact foot perfusion
Lower threshold for prophylactic fasciotomy with tibial vascular injuries

content.clinical_significance: Limb viability depends on overall tibial runoff
content.statement: Tibial Vessel Injury is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Trauma that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Tibial Vessel Injury helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Tibial Vessel Injury include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Tibial Vessel Injury.
